div.bibl: Illinois Staats-Zeitung, Mar. 18, 1879. [THE CHICAGO MINING AND MILLING COMPANY](Advertisement) The Chicago Mining and Milling Company Incorporated Under the Laws of the State of Illinois December 30, 1878

body.p: Messrs. Fraser and Chalmers are building in Chicago the ore-crushing machinery for the reduction works which are to be installed in the Company's property, which consists of twenty-two of the richest silver mines in the Globe district, Pinal County, Arizona.
A large supply of rich ore has already been mined, and is available for treatment as soon as the mill is completed, thus assuring an immediate income to the Company.
A limited number of nonassessable bonds, par value $100, are for sale at $25 by
who will be pleased to give any desired information, verbally or in writing.
